articles.author: Mohammad Ponir Hossain, Sam Jahan
articles.description: Bangladesh extended a curfew on Sunday to control violent student-led protests that have killed at least 114 people, as authorities braced for a Supreme Court hearing later in the day on government job quotas that sparked the anger.
articles.title: Bangladesh extends curfew ahead of court hearing on controversial job quotas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine needs long-range weapons to protect its cities and troops on the frontline from Russian bombs and drones, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday after a massive overnight drone and missile attack.
articles.title: Zelenskiy calls for long-range weapons after drone attack on Kyiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines will resupply a beached naval ship in the South China Sea with food and provisions on its own, despite an offer from the United States for help, Manila security officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Philippines to resupply ship on South China Sea shoal without US help

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Azerbaijan is proposing to sign a document with Armenia on the basic principles of a future peace treaty as an interim measure as they wrangle over a broader deal, a senior Azerbaijani official said on Sunday.
articles.title: Azerbaijan proposes document on principles of peace before full deal with Armenia

articles.author: Angelo Amante, Gavin Jones
articles.description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's decision not to back Ursula von der Leyen as European Commission chief was driven by fear of losing rightwing grassroots supporters, analysts say, but may curb her influence over EU choices.
articles.title: Italy's Meloni put domestic concerns first in rejecting von der Leyen

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Tayyip Erdogan believes a potential change in the U.S. administration after November's election may be positive for Turkey's growing defence industry, he was quoted as saying by Turkish media on Sunday.
articles.title: Erdogan says US vote could further boost Turkey arms sector, TRT reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China released a 60-point document on Sunday on policy goals, ranging from developing advanced industries to improving the business environment, adopted at the end of a Communist Party Central Committee meeting, but with few implementation details.
articles.title: China publishes policy agenda with few implementation details

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea on Sunday was floating balloons carrying trash towards South Korea, the South's Joint Chiefs of Staff said.
articles.title: North Korea floats trash balloons towards South

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Defence Ministry said on Sunday that Russian warplanes prevented two U.S. strategic bombers from violating the state border over the Barents Sea.
articles.title: Russia says its jets prevented US bombers violating border over Barents Sea

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Donald Trump will hold his first campaign rally on Saturday since he narrowly escaped an assassination attempt one week ago and fresh from his nominating convention where his takeover of the Republican Party was cemented.
articles.title: Trump to hold first campaign rally after assassination attempt
